description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Windows Hyper-V shared virtual disk elevation of privilege vulnerability (CVE-2024-43624), it is crucial to apply the appropriate security updates.

1. Identify the Windows version your system is using.
2. Download and apply the relevant KB update from the links provided below.
3. Restart your system to ensure the updates take effect.

**Details**:
- The following updates are available for installation:
  - Windows 11 Version 24H2: [KB5046617](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046617)
  - Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5046633](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046633)
  - Windows 10 Version 22H2: [KB5046613](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046613)
- The vulnerability can lead to significant privilege escalation.
- Ensure that your system meets the build requirements before installation.

**Preconditions**:
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
- Verify that your Windows build numbers match those specified for the updates.
